meaning list.sentence translation: Dit het homself keer op keer betroubaar bewys.

meaning list.sentence: Time flies when you’re having fun.
meaning list.sentence translation: Tyd gaan vinnig verby as jy pret het.

meaning list.sentence: After years in the same job, it’s time for a change.
meaning list.sentence translation: Na jare in dieselfde werk, is dit tyd vir 'n verandering.

word: time heals all wounds (or time is a great healer)

meaning list.sentence: Don’t worry; time heals all wounds.
meaning list.sentence translation: Moenie bekommerd wees nie; Tyd genees alles.

meaning list.sentence: Let’s not waste time; time is money.
meaning list.sentence translation: Laat ons nie tyd mors nie; Tyd is waardevol.

meaning list.sentence: Time is of the essence, so we need to act quickly.
meaning list.sentence translation: Tyd is van kardinale belang, daarom moet ons vinnig optree.

meaning list.meaning: Die beste tyd van jou lewe (idioom)
meaning list.sentence: We had the time of our lives on our vacation.
meaning list.sentence translation: Ons het die beste tyd van ons lewe met vakansie gehad.

meaning list.sentence: Now that he’s retired, he has time on his hands.
meaning list.sentence translation: Noudat hy afgetree het, het hy genoeg tyd.

meaning list.meaning: Om nie te kan praat nie as gevolg van opgewondenheid of verleentheid (idioom)
meaning list.sentence: He was tongue-tied during the interview.
meaning list.sentence translation: Hy kon nie tydens die onderhoud praat nie weens opgewondenheid.

word: too many chiefs and not enough Indians
phonetic american: tuː ˈmɛni tʃiːfs ənd nɑːt ɪˈnʌf ˈɪndiənz
phonetic british: tuː ˈmɛni tʃiːfs ənd nɒt ɪˈnʌf ˈɪndiənz

meaning list.meaning: Te veel leiers maar nie genoeg werknemers nie (idioom)
meaning list.sentence: The project failed because there were too many chiefs and not enough Indians.
meaning list.sentence translation: Die projek het misluk omdat daar te veel leiers was, maar nie genoeg werknemers nie.

word: too much (free) time on one's hands
phonetic american: tuː mʌtʃ taɪm ɑn wʌnz hændz
phonetic british: tuː mʌtʃ taɪm ɒn wʌnz hændz

meaning list.meaning: Om baie vrye tyd te hê en dit te mors (idioom)
meaning list.sentence: He started spreading rumors because he has too much time on his hands.
meaning list.sentence translation: Aangesien hy baie vrye tyd gehad het, het hy begin skinderpraatjies versprei.

meaning list.sentence: He’s the top banana in the company.
meaning list.sentence translation: Hy is die leier van die maatskappy.

meaning list.meaning: Die mees kragtige of suksesvolle persoon (idioom)
meaning list.sentence: After winning the competition, he became the top dog in his field.
meaning list.sentence translation: Nadat hy die kompetisie gewen het, het hy die sterkste persoon in sy veld geword.

meaning list.meaning: Sterk persoon wat moeilike situasies kan hanteer (idioom)
meaning list.sentence: She’s a tough cookie; she never gives up.
meaning list.sentence translation: Hy is 'n sterk persoon wat moeilike situasies kan hanteer; Hy gee nooit moed op nie.

meaning list.meaning: Spesiale kennis of metodes wat in 'n werk gebruik word (idioom)
meaning list.sentence: He learned the tricks of the trade from his mentor.
meaning list.sentence translation: Hy het die ingewikkeldhede van die beroep by sy mentor geleer.

meaning list.meaning: Om iemand se ware karakter of bedoelings te wys (idioom)
meaning list.sentence: She showed her true colours when she refused to help.
meaning list.sentence translation: Hy het sy ware kleure gewys toe hy geweier het om te help.

word: turn back the hands of time
phonetic american: tɜːrn bæk ðə hændz əv taɪm
phonetic british: tɜːn bæk ðə hændz əv taɪm

meaning list.meaning: Om terug te keer na die verlede of tyd terug te draai (idioom)
meaning list.sentence: If I could turn back the hands of time, I’d make a different decision.
meaning list.sentence translation: As ek tyd kon terugdraai, sou ek ’n ander besluit geneem het.

meaning list.sentence: He never went to college but learned everything from the university of life.
meaning list.sentence translation: Hy het nie universiteit toe gegaan nie, maar hy het alles uit die lewe geleer.

meaning list.meaning: Iets wat nooit sal gebeur nie (idioom)
meaning list.sentence: You can wait until hell freezes over, but I won’t change my mind.
meaning list.sentence translation: Jy kan vir ewig wag, maar ek sal nie van plan verander nie.

meaning list.sentence: All our hard work went up in smoke when the project was canceled.
meaning list.sentence translation: Al ons harde werk het in die drein geval toe die projek gekanselleer is.

meaning list.sentence: She’s waiting in the wings for a chance to prove herself.
meaning list.sentence translation: Hy wag vir 'n geleentheid om homself te bewys.

meaning list.meaning: om iemand te laat vaar of teleur te stel (idioom)
meaning list.sentence: He walked out on his family when things got tough.
meaning list.sentence translation: Toe dinge moeilik raak, het hy sy gesin verlaat.

meaning list.sentence: We’re wasting time discussing irrelevant issues.
meaning list.sentence translation: Ons mors tyd om irrelevante onderwerpe te bespreek.

meaning list.meaning: Stelsel of groep wat glad verloop (idioom)
meaning list.sentence: The team works like a well-oiled machine.
meaning list.sentence translation: Die span werk soos 'n gladlopende stelsel.

meaning list.sentence: We had a whale of a time at the amusement park.
meaning list.sentence translation: Ons het heerlik gekuier by die pretpark.

meaning list.meaning: Om baie bleek te wees van vrees of siekte (idioom)
meaning list.sentence: He turned white as a sheet when he heard the news.
meaning list.sentence translation: Hy het bleek geword toe hy die nuus hoor.

meaning list.meaning: kantoorwerker, persoon wat geestelike werk doen (idioom)
meaning list.sentence: White-collar jobs are becoming more common in urban areas.
meaning list.sentence translation: Witboordjiewerk word al hoe meer algemeen in stedelike gebiede.

meaning list.meaning: Iets wat te veel kos, maar nutteloos is (idioom)
meaning list.sentence: The stadium turned out to be a white elephant for the city.
meaning list.sentence translation: Die stadion was 'n duur maar nuttelose belegging vir die stad.

meaning list.sentence: She told a white lie to avoid hurting his feelings.
meaning list.sentence translation: Hy het 'n klein leuentjie vertel om nie haar gevoelens seer te maak nie.

meaning list.meaning: om 'n fout of fout te verbloem (idioom)
meaning list.sentence: The company tried to whitewash the scandal.
meaning list.sentence translation: Die maatskappy het die skandaal probeer toesmeer.

meaning list.sentence: When they throw a party, they go the whole nine yards with decorations and food.
meaning list.sentence translation: Wanneer hulle 'n partytjie hou, gaan hulle almal uit met versierings en kos.

meaning list.sentence: I’ll be at your party with bells on!
meaning list.sentence translation: Ek sal met groot opgewondenheid na jou partytjie toe kom!

meaning list.meaning: Prys of titel gegee aan die persoon wat laaste kom (idioom)
meaning list.sentence: They were awarded the wooden spoon for finishing last in the league.
meaning list.sentence translation: Hulle het die houtlepel-toekenning ontvang omdat hulle laaste in die liga was.

meaning list.sentence: This new cleaning product works like a charm.
meaning list.sentence translation: Hierdie nuwe skoonmaakproduk werk perfek.

meaning list.meaning: Ek sou nooit in 'n situasie doen of in 'n situasie wees nie (idioom)
meaning list.sentence: I wouldn’t be caught dead wearing that outfit.
meaning list.sentence translation: Ek sal nooit daardie uitrusting dra nie.

meaning list.meaning: Herhaaldelik, jaar na jaar, vir jare (idioom)
meaning list.sentence: They visit the same beach year in, year out.
meaning list.sentence translation: Hulle besoek elke jaar dieselfde strand.

meaning list.sentence: He’s too yellow-bellied to confront his boss.
meaning list.sentence translation: Hy is te veel van 'n lafaard om sy baas te konfronteer.

word: you can't teach an old dog new tricks
phonetic american: juː kænt tiːʧ ən oʊld dɔːɡ nuː trɪks
phonetic british: juː kɑːnt tiːʧ ən əʊld dɒɡ njuː trɪks

meaning list.meaning: Dit is moeilik om iemand met ou gewoontes te verander (idioom)
meaning list.sentence: He refuses to learn how to use a smartphone; you can’t teach an old dog new tricks.
meaning list.sentence translation: Hy weier om te leer hoe om ’n slimfoon te gebruik; Dit is moeilik om ou gewoontes te verander.

word: your guess is as good as mine
phonetic american: jʊr gɛs ɪz æz ɡʊd æz maɪn
phonetic british: jɔːr gɛs ɪz æz ɡʊd æz maɪn

meaning list.meaning: Ek weet ook nie, albei ons raaiskote is dalk ewe akkuraat (idioom)
meaning list.sentence: Why the train is late? Your guess is as good as mine.
meaning list.sentence translation: Hoekom was die trein laat? Ek weet ook nie.
